intro: Trichocline scapigera, commonly known as the scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking red to orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Trichocline scapigera is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
